org.hypknowsys.wumprep.config
Class LogfileTemplate

java.lang.Object
  org.hypknowsys.wumprep.config.LogfileTemplate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class LogfileTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Encapsulates a WUMprep log file template.

getTemplateFile

public java.lang.String getTemplateFile()
Gets the temlate file encapsulated by this LogilfeTemplate.

Returns:
The template file's absolute path.

setTemplateFile

public void setTemplateFile(java.lang.String path)
Sets the template file encapsulated by this LogfileTemplate.

Parameters:
path - The absolute path of the template file to parse.

init

private void init(java.io.File templateFile)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Initializes this by parsing a given WUMprep log file template and constructing a regular expression from it that can be used for parsing log lines conforming to the template.

Parameters:
templateFile - The WUMprep configuration file to construct this LogfileTemplate from.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the templateFile is not a valid WUMprep configuration file.

getTemplate

public java.lang.String getTemplate()
Gets the template line as defined in the WUMprep template file.

Returns:
The template.

setTemplate

public void setTemplate(java.lang.String template)
Sets the template line.

Parameters:
template - The template.

getFields

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getFields()
Gets the list of fields used in the template, ordered by appearance. This list may be used as an index for accessing selected fields from a log line parsed with the regular expression returned by getRegExp().

Returns:
The field list.

getRegExp

public java.lang.String getRegExp()
Gets the regular expression built from the log line template. Every field matching sub-expression is enclosed in grouping parentheses, so that each field from a log line can easily be accessed using the Matcher.group(int) method.

Returns:
The regular expression that parses a log line formatted according to the template.

getPattern

public java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern()
Gets a Pattern that can be used to create a Matcher for parsing log lines as in the following example: 
         LogfileTemplate lt = new LogfileTemplate("someTemplateFile");
         Matcher m = lt.getPattern.matcher(<String> logLine);
         m.matches();
         
         for (int i = 0; i < getStructure().numAttributes(); i++)
           System.out.println("Field No. " + i + ": " + m.group(i + 1));

Returns:
The pattern for parsing log lines.
